alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Hardee; Highlands; Manatee; Sarasota (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 28 at 10:45PM EDT until September 29 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Hardee County in central Florida... Western DeSoto County in south central Florida... Northwestern Highlands County in south central Florida... Manatee County in west central Florida... Northeastern Sarasota County in west central Florida... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 1045 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain associated with Hurricane Ian across the warned area. Between 10 and 18 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rainfall producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sebring, Avon Park, Arcadia, Wauchula, Ona, Southeast Arcadia, Myakka City, Sweetwater, Zolfo Springs, Limestone, Gardner, Brownville, Myakka Head, Nocatee, Fort Green, Crewsville, Fort Ogden, Avon Park Executive Airport and Sebring Shores. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
